subject: Relationships
title: Emotional Bids and Turning Toward
description: One-minute skill: Emotional Bids and Turning Toward.

hook.text: He sighs heavily. She can ignore it, criticize it, or ask what's wrong. Only one response builds trust.

buildup.text: Turning toward a partner's emotional bid means responding with interest. Turning away means ignoring it.

discovery.text: Couples who turn toward each other's bids 86% of the time are still together six years later.

twist.text: Turning against â€” responding with hostility to a bid â€” is actually less damaging than turning away entirely.

climax.text: Indifference is worse than anger. At least anger acknowledges your partner exists. Silence erases them.

punchline.text: Indifference hurts more than anger. Silence erases people.

quiz.question: Which response to emotional bids is most damaging?
